bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frederick L. Rath, Jr., March 19, 1952

div1.p: Hench has written to Rojas and Cabrera. He hopes that they invite Rath to visit, and offers to help if they do so.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frederick L. Rath, Jr., March 19, 1952
div1.opener:
March 19, 1952
Mr. Frederick L. Rath, Jr., Director
National Council for Historic Sites and Buildings
712 Jackson Place, N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
My dear Mr. Rath:
div1.p:
As soon as I received your letter I wrote to my friends, Senora Maria
Rojas and Senorita Lydia Cabrera, Finca San Jose, Calzada Real y Gomez
Redencion, Quemados, de Marianao, Havana. I enclose a copy of my
letter.

I hope indeed that they ask you down and if they do I stand ready to
do what I can to aid you. I shall be anxious to know if you hear from
them.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
